items.title: 4 Dead After Shooting at Banquet Hall in California
items.summary: The shooting in Stockton, a city in California’s Central Valley, left 11 others wounded. The authorities said they were looking for a suspect.

items.title: Trump Frees Fraudster Just Days Into Seven-Year Prison Sentence
items.summary: David Gentile had been found guilty for his role in what prosecutors described as a $1.6 billion scheme that defrauded thousands of investors.

items.title: Webster Springs, W.Va. United In Grief Over Death of National Guard Specialist Sarah Beckstrom
items.summary: In Webster Springs, everyone knows one another. When National Guard Specialist Sarah Beckstrom was killed, that connection was even further strengthened.

items.title: Top Trump Aides to Meet With Ukrainians in Florida on Sunday
items.summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner plan to discuss peace terms again after an uproar over a 28-point proposal drafted with Russian input.

items.title: Afghans Who Assisted U.S. During the War Underwent Rigorous Vetting
items.summary: Former officials said the C.I.A. diligently assessed those who partnered with its forces, like the man accused of shooting two National Guard members in Washington.

items.title: Utah Hiker Rescued With His Children Faces Abuse and Torture Charges
items.summary: The man was initially hailed for his efforts to protect his daughter, 8, and two sons, 4 and 2, but the authorities concluded that he put them at risk by taking them on perilous terrain.

items.title: All the president’s millions: how the Trumps are turning the presidency into riches
items.summary: <p>From Vietnam to the Balkans, Donald Trump’s family has launched a global dealmaking blitz since his re-election</p><p>A crusading prosecutor in the Balkans comes under pressure to drop a big case. Vietnamese villagers learn they are to be evicted. A convicted crypto kingpin in the Gulf receives a pardon.</p><p>All have one thing in common: they appear to be connected to the Trump family’s campaign to amass riches around the world. Since Donald Trump’s re-election a year ago, warnings that his use of presidential power to advance personal interests is corroding American democracy have grown ever louder. What is less understood – and perhaps even more dangerous – is the damage this is doing everywhere else.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ng-interactive/2025/nov/30/all-the-presidents-millions-how-the-trumps-are-turning-the-presidency-into-riches">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: At least four killed in shooting at child’s birthday party in northern California
items.summary: <p>San Joaquin County sheriff’s office says children were among the victims in possible ‘targeted’ attack on a banquet hall in Stockton</p><p>Four people have died after 14 people were shot at a family gathering in northern <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/california">California</a> on Saturday night, police said.</p><p>Heather Brent, a spokesperson for the San Joaquin County sheriff’s office, said children and adults were among the victims of the shooting at Stockton.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/30/stockton-banquet-hall-shooting-california">Continue reading...</a>
